instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 Fan spins for one second than stops cycle
threads.message:
I have this board
apparently no short, also checked main voltages and current sensing circuit around u7200 for wrong resistor values. Didn't find the cause of the problem so far.

threads.title: 820-3115 Fan spins for one second than stops cycle
threads.message:
Check if all coils pulse in that second.
Inspect R7402/03.

threads.title: 820-3115 Fan spins for one second than stops cycle
threads.message: In the mean time I desoldered and read the SPI content... Found a completely blank SPI rom!!! Reprogrammed and now I finally got it booting! I wonder how could have the spi ROM been erased completely ?

threads.title: 820-3115 Fan spins for one second than stops cycle
threads.message: The only problem I'm experiencing so far it's with the ram slots that are both not reliable anymore. Sometimesthey works sometimes I have to re-insert the ram in the slot different times before it will be recognized. That was usually happening in the upper slot, don't know why I have it on both.

threads.title: 820-3115 Fan spins for one second than stops cycle
threads.message:
Try to clean the slots better.
You can also resolder the contacts near the edge of the slots (in the MLB)..

threads.title: 820-3115 Fan spins for one second than stops cycle
threads.message:
Great! Never tried manual resoldering of ram slots. 
Thanks
